results.title: Ode to a shoebox
results.creator_credit: Narada Lawson and ACMI Digital Storytelling
results.brief_description: The outside walls of the housing commission flats were as grey as a winter’s day and as cold as charity. But inside was a warm world of fun, love an adventure. This is an account of living in public housing in Melbourne.
results.description: The outside walls of the housing commission flats were as grey as a winter’s day and as cold as charity. But inside was a warm world of fun, love an adventure. This is an account of living in public housing in Melbourne.

results.title: Mapping a city of fragments v.2
results.material_description: Single channel moving image, black and white and colour and audio
results.brief_description: Using the opening of Godard’s film ‘Alphaville’ as a foundation, Lord constructs a vision of the evolving global city during the last years of the 20th Century. Structured as a series of repetitions, the montage of the changing city is offset by shots of Silicon Valley corporate facades. The result is a dialectical contrast between urban and suburban space, body and mind, chaos and order, and the post-modern and the modern. Shot in Hi-8 video in Tokyo, Fukuoka City, Mexico City, Rome, San Francisco, Naples and Los Angeles.

results.title: The Judy spots
results.material_description: Single channel moving image, black and white and audio
results.brief_description:
‘The Judy spots’ consists of five short videos featuring a papier-mache puppet called Judy. Clever, witty and extremely dark, each of the vignettes is a social commentary about human emotions and behavior.
The vignettes are: ‘Judy feels sad’, ‘Judy hates her job’, ‘Judy has a nightmare’, ‘Judy goes to the mall’ and ‘Judy gets mad’.

results.title: Drift
results.material_description: Single channel moving image, colour and black and white, silent
results.brief_description: Since the first Apollo moon landing in the 1960s, NASA has compiled an enormous photographic record of its lunar saga. San Francisco photographer Michael Light gained access to the original negatives, presenting his collection of photography in major American and European museums including San Francisco Museum of Modern Art. As a reprise to his photographic exhibition ‘Full Moon’, Light has created ‘Drift’, an epic seven-minute loop of composite still imagery taken during NASA’s moon missions.

results.title: Flat is beautiful
results.material_description: Single channel moving image, black and white and audio
results.brief_description: Partly shot in Pixelvision and partly in Super 8 and using a combination of hand-drawn masks, animation and live action, this experimental film explores the theme of gender identity through the eyes of androgenous 11-year-old Taylor (Sammy Steel).
results.description: Partly shot in Pixelvision and partly in Super 8 and using a combination of hand-drawn masks, animation and live action, this experimental film explores the theme of gender identity through the eyes of androgenous 11-year-old Taylor (Sammy Steel).

results.title: Ozala
results.brief_description:
“Ozala” is an Afghani refugee who spent three years in a detention centre - his only crime was in wanting freedom. During this time in prison Ozala discovered the art of painting, where he could express his emotions, where shapes and colors became symbolic of his life and experiences and where he could escape to freedom. A thoughtful and reflective film interspersed with images of Ozala’s paintings.
In Farsi (Persian) with English subtitles
